questions.question: How it works?
questions.text:
Everything is super simple and just a few clicks away!

1. Click the START FREE TRIAL (link to the bot) button on the website.
2. Choose a suitable plan (link to the plans page) or try the free trial period.
3. In the chat, get acquainted with the account manager and your assistant, who will be assigned to you. Tell them about yourself, your business, and your expectations.
4. Describe the task, agree on the deliverables (for example, a Google spreadsheet, a to-do list), deadlines, and in what form the task should be completed. The account manager will ask clarifying questions, pass them on to the assistant, and immediately start working on the task.
5. The account manager will notify you when the task is completed.
6. Use the AI capabilities directly in the chatbot.
7. Receive a weekly or monthly report.

questions.question: How does JetOffice provide assistance services to employees of my company?
questions.text: For corporate clients, we offer two schemes: Scheme #1: Separate chat groups 1. Separate chat groups are created for employees, top management, and C-level in Telegram, Slack, or another suitable messenger. The group includes an Account Manager, assistants, and company personnel. It is recommended to have no more than 50-80 employees in one chat. 2. Together with the client, we distribute the hours for task execution between chat groups, establish regulations, conditions, and priorities. 3. In ClickUp, by default from JetOffice, or in any other task management program from the client side (optional), separate task categories are created for each chat group, where all tasks are entered and the time for performing these tasks is logged. 4. Logged time is summed up. At the end of the month, a report is generated. Scheme #2: chatbot for Each employee 1. Each employee has access to JetOffice.app - a chatbot, where they can directly contact an assistant and also use AI-based solutions. 2. Together with the client, we create user groups. Together with the client, we distribute the hours for task execution between groups, establish regulations, conditions, and priorities. 3. In ClickUp, by default from JetOffice, or in any other task management program from the client side (optional), separate task categories are created for each user group, where all tasks are entered, and the time for performing these tasks is logged. 4. Logged time is summed up. At the end of the month, a report is generated.

questions.question: How does JetOffice work with private clients and companies? What is the difference?
questions.text:
The difference lies in the number of employees served by virtual assistants and the different channels of communication. If a company has many employees, JetOffice can create a common chat for all employees. Consequently, more time and more assistants are needed to cover tasks for companies. For large corporations, JetOffice can offer a special deal that is more advantageous than other subscription plans. Check the rates here (link to prices page). Contact mail@jetoffice.org to get an offer for large corporations.

On the other hand, for private clients, one assistant and cheaper rates may be sufficient.

questions.question: Can a common group chat be created for company employees?
questions.text: Yes, that is possible. We can create a common chat in Telegram or any other messenger application.

questions.question: What messengers can be used?
questions.text: JetOffice uses Telegram for internal needs, for communication with clients, and for using JetOffice.app. However, we are ready to integrate into any corporate messenger that the company uses.

questions.question: What makes JetOffice more advantageous, better, or cheaper than an in-house employee?
questions.text: Firstly, we provide a service. This means that the recruitment, selection, replacement, training, and internship of employees are our responsibility. The company does not need to maintain an employee, pay taxes, train, monitor quality, etc. The company only delegates tasks and does not have to worry about anything else. Secondly, you pay for as many hours as you need for effective work. There is even the possibility of hourly payment. On more expensive tariff plans, you can really hire an in-house employee, but then training, replacement, and other issues fall on your shoulders. This is a questionable saving, isn't it? Thirdly, a virtual assistant (outsourced assistant) is not much different from an in-house assistant, administrative assistant, or secretary in terms of effectiveness - they are also immersed in the context: they understand the tasks of the business and the needs of the client. The cherry on top: we have a cool network of partners (from product development to coaching), as well as our own AI-based product for automating your routine processes. And you get all this in one box, in one chat.

questions.question: How can I manage if I need to do something offline? Can JetOffice solve this?
questions.text: Of course! For us, these are the same working hours. We can find a person anywhere in the world who agrees to complete the task offline: go to the store, check the apartment, or pick up things from the laundry. We will pay this person for their time according to the assistant's rate.

questions.question: Where are you from?
questions.text: Illia and Oksana, the founders, are from Ukraine, and we consider our startup to be Ukrainian. However, our team is international.

questions.question: What communication channels does JetOffice support?
questions.text:
We can agree on any communication channel that is convenient for you. By default, it is a Telegram bot - the most preferred and convenient because everything is set up for comfortable work.

Some clients prefer Slack or Facebook Workplace chat.

questions.question: Can I contact the assistant personally?
questions.text:
The chatbot already provides direct access to the assistant. You know who you are communicating with, and if there are several assistants in the chat, it will be clear who is writing. The ability to write directly to an assistant in Telegram is available, but it is not advisable because then this correspondence is not visible to the account manager and there is no possibility to use AI for process automation.

It is forbidden to lure our employees to work for you without an agreement with JetOffice. It is also forbidden to ask to complete tasks that go beyond working hours.

In any case, any task will be confidential. But for the client's peace of mind, you can write to the assistant personally and then return to the chatbot.

questions.question: Can I communicate with the assistant using voice messages, online calls, or phone calls?
questions.text: Yes, you can.

questions.question: How do I know who my assistants are and who is my content manager?
questions.text: You can easily check this in the chatbot under the "My Account" information.

questions.question: What tasks does JetOffice not perform?
questions.text: JetOffice provides comprehensive business solutions by connecting you with qualified vendors. While we address most needs virtually, we can also introduce you to vendors for tasks requiring physical presence. However, there are specific tasks we don't undertake. 1. Specialized Consultations: We recommend seeking experts in the respective field for highly specialized tasks. 2. High-Risk Tasks: We do not handle requests associated with significant financial or legal risks without detailed analysis. 3. Breach of Confidentiality: Tasks that might compromise personal information or safety are not accepted. 4. Illegal Requests: Any actions or requests that breach the law will be declined. 5. Fraud and Financial Pyramids: Requests related to participating in financial pyramids, fraudulent schemes, or other activities that are illegal or unethical are strictly prohibited. 6. Usage of "Black Hat" Tactics: Any requests to use virtual assistants for manipulations, bypassing laws, or unfair competition will be declined. 7. Breach of Ethical Principles: Tasks that might harm the reputation of your company or ours, or contradict commonly accepted ethical standards, are not accepted. 8. Contradiction to Corporate Values: If a task doesn't align with the principles and values of JetOffice or the individual values of the assistant, a decision might be made to decline its execution. 9. Unrealistic Deadlines: Tasks with unattainable deadlines may be reviewed or declined.

questions.question: Are There Any Restrictions on Cooperation with Companies Registered in Russia or Russian Citizens?
questions.text: At the moment, we do not collaborate with Russian companies, do not accept payments from Russian accounts, and do not undertake tasks related to the territory of Russia or Russian vendors. However, we do not discriminate based on nationality or passport and treat all individuals with respect. This means that we collaborate with Russian citizens who do not reside in Russia and do not pay taxes in Russia. We also collaborate with relocated companies. We believe in peace and that cooperation and respect will lead to peace between our nations.

questions.question: What happens if I don't use all the hours included in my plan?
questions.text: If you haven't used the hours included in your plan by the end of the month â€” they expire. JetOffice does not carry over these hours to the next month and does not refund the money.

questions.question: Can I upgrade of downgrade my plan anytime?
questions.text: Monthly Subscription: Upgrade: Clients can upgrade their subscription at any time by paying the price difference between the current and new plans. Downgrade: Clients can downgrade their plan only after the current month's subscription period ends. No refunds are provided. Yearly Subscription: Upgrade: Clients can upgrade their subscription at any time. The additional payment is calculated based on the price difference between plans and the remaining time until the end of the yearly subscription. Downgrade: Transition to a lower plan is possible only after the yearly subscription ends. Switch from Yearly to Monthly: The transition is allowed only after the yearly subscription ends. No refunds are provided. After the yearly subscription ends, clients can choose a monthly plan. Cancellation of Yearly Subscription: Client-initiated cancellation of the yearly subscription incurs a penalty equal to the cost of three months' subscription.

questions.question: What happens if I go over monthly hours?
questions.text:
Our system is designed to remind users when they approach the end of their hours or billing period. This ensures that you won't exceed the time limit without your knowledge. When the system notifies you about reaching your time limit, you'll have the following options:

1. Purchase a new package: In this case, the countdown will start from a new date.
2. Use hourly rate billing: To do this, you'll need to deposit funds into your account.
3. Suspend task execution until the beginning of the next billing period.

If your package hours run out, you won't be able to work beyond the allocated hours until you purchase a new package or opt for hourly rate billing.

questions.question: Which subscription is best for me?
questions.text: Start With Free Trial: Try it out, test it, evaluate it. You'll love it! Three hours are enough for a small test. Hourly Rate: If you need more time to get familiar with JetOffice assistants, use our hourly rate. It's not as cost-effective as monthly plans, but it allows you to fully assess the service. Get Up to 20% Off: More hours, more discounts! PERSONAL: Good for getting acquainted with the service, small businesses, or personal use. With this plan, JetOffice provides you with an account manager and a part-time assistant. The price per hour is $6.6 with a yearly subscription and $7.9 per hour with a monthly subscription. STARTUP: The golden middle ground. With this plan, you get a full-time assistant for better task immersion and an account manager. You also get an 11% discount compared to the PERSONAL plan. The hourly rate is $5.9 with a yearly subscription and $7.1 per hour with a monthly subscription. BUSINESS: For in-depth work and multitasking. With this plan, you can handle multiple tasks simultaneously because you'll have three full-time assistants and a manager. You'll also get a 20% discount compared to the PERSONAL plan. The hourly rate is $5.2 with a yearly subscription and $6.3 per hour with a monthly subscription. ENTERPRISE: This offers an individualized approach to get more assistants at a more favorable price.

questions.question: How to use hourly pay?
questions.text:
Here are the instructions on how to use the hourly pay option:

1. In the chatbot, select "HOURLY PAY $10."
2. Add a balance in multiples of $10.
3. The system will notify you of the purchased amount of time.
4. You can start working.
5. When your balance is running low, the system will alert you about the depletion of funds.

The deposit model helps you control your funds more attentively and stay within your budget and expectations.
Please note that unused time cannot be refunded or used to pay for subscription packages due to technical limitations of the payment system. However, you can always use these funds for hourly payments, and they have no expiration date.

questions.question: Annual and monthly commitment
questions.text: The main difference between Annual and Monthly commitment lies in the price and the terms of the agreement. Let's break it down in detail: Annual commitment: The primary benefit for customers when purchasing an Annual commitment plan is a lower hourly rate, and the assurance of a dedicated team focused on your tasks and needs for an extended period. With an annual subscription, you receive up to 20% discount compared to monthly payments. This discount accounts for the inclusion of the risks associated with employee downtime in the monthly pricing. For example, the difference in the annual budget on the STARTUP plan between monthly and annual commitment would be $17,040 per year with monthly payments and $14,200 with an annual commitment. This means you save $2,840 per year, which is a 16.7%. However, there are specific considerations that compensate for these lower prices: 1. You cannot downgrade your subscription until the end of the billing cycle (which means not until the year ends), but you can upgrade at any time. 2. Canceling your subscription with an annual commitment incurs a penalty equivalent to three months of the subscription cost, excluding the current month. 3. During payment, the entire annual amount will be charged upfront. Monthly commitment: JetOffice values flexibility, convenience, and simplicity. When you choose a monthly subscription, you are not tied to long-term commitments, but keep in mind that this type of agreement will make your annual expenses higher. Please note that transitioning from a monthly subscription to an annual commitment is straightforward, but the reverse is not possible. For detailed information on transitioning between plans, please refer to "Can I upgrade or downgrade my plan anytime?" We recommend starting with a monthly subscription to get acquainted with JetOffice and build trust, and then consider transitioning to an annual commitment for cost savings.

questions.question: When and How Is Payment Made? What Payment Options Are Available? What Currencies Are Accepted?
questions.text: We offer flexibility when it comes to payment options, and we can accommodate various payment methods, including cash, bank transfers, cryptocurrency, and even barter arrangements where services or goods can be exchanged for JetOffice services. Let's dive into the details: When is Payment Made? nWe operate on a 100% upfront payment model. If you have any reservations, we recommend starting with a free trial period or using our hourly payment option with a small balance on your account. How is Payment Made? We provide several payment methods: 1. Bank Transfer: You can make a payment by transferring funds via SWIFT or SEPA. Your account manager will send you a proforma invoice for the prepayment of our services. 2. Payment Gateway in the Chat: We've integrated a payment gateway into our chat interface, allowing you to pay with any credit card from around the world and in any currency. Simply start using the JetOffice chat, select "Subscription," and follow the instructions to make a payment. 3. Cryptocurrency: We plan to introduce a payment gateway for cryptocurrency transactions. If it's not available yet, your account manager will provide you with a cryptocurrency wallet address. Please note that we comply with tax regulations for cryptocurrency transactions. 4. In-Person Meeting: While less common, we can arrange a personal meeting for payment. In this case, we'll prepare a proforma invoice, and you can choose to receive it in print or via email. Rest assured that we aim to make the payment process as convenient as possible for you, regardless of the method you choose. If you have any further questions or need assistance with payments, please feel free to ask.

questions.question: Can I subscribe to multiple plans simultaneously?
questions.text: Yes, you can. Essentially, it will be just the sum of hours.

questions.question: What is Remote payments & Deposit account and how can I use it?
questions.text: A JetOffice deposit provides several possibilities: 1. Firstly, you can use it for hourly payment. You deposit money into your balance and use JetOffice services for as long as there is money on your account. It's convenient because you can limit your spending. 2. Secondly, the deposit allows you to make payments on your behalf or on behalf of your company. This is very convenient for various operational and routine payments, such as cleaning services, ticket bookings, accommodation, and so on. We call it Remote payments. Remote payments are a type of service where we pay bills on your behalf. In this way, you only confirm the transaction, and we handle everything else. The transaction is processed from our bank account, while the funds are deducted from your balance. This way, we have bypassed the necessity of linking your card to our service. In the future, we will strive to add the option for clients to link their card and make transactions directly from it. Attention! JetOffice limits the payment capabilities. We do not pay for: risky transactions, business deals, investment transactions, payments to exchanges and brokers, currency purchases and conversions, the purchase of illegal goods such as weapons, drugs, etc. Anything that has serious consequences and requires specialized expertise falls outside the scope of our remote payment service. We can only process non-risky payments and transactions that do not require professional auditing, such as: - Ordering food or a taxi. - Paying for simple services, such as car repairs or house cleaning. - Buying tickets, booking accommodations, renting transportation. - Purchasing movie tickets or paying for a restaurant reservation. - Paying for grocery orders or personal items. - And much more... The key is that the financial transaction should be legal and not require in-depth and specialized auditing. Attention! We are not responsible for any consequences faced by the client in Remote payments once the client has approved the payment. After payment approval, for example, purchasing plane tickets with specific dates, the responsibility lies with the client. Attention! We reserve the right to decline the Remote Payment service if we deem it risky, dangerous, or illegal.

questions.question: When can JetOffice start working?
questions.text: This depends on the availability of assistants and the size of your company. Sometimes it may take us from a few days to a few weeks to assemble a team. Of course, the package's start time will be counted from the launch day.

questions.question: Where are my data stored?
questions.text: Your data is hosted on AWS (Amazon Web Services) servers, a leader in cloud solutions with numerous security certifications, such as ISO 27001, PCI DSS Level 1, and more. Depending on the specific services you use, some data may also be stored on Telegram and ClickUp servers. Telegram uses distributed servers worldwide, ensuring fast performance and security, while ClickUp utilizes AWS infrastructure for its data storage.

questions.question: Will you share my data with third parties?
questions.text: We do not share data with third parties unless agreed upon with you or if it's required to accomplish a specific task. For example, if ticket purchasing requires your data, we pass it on to aggregator services. However, we do not allow data leaks and do not share corporate information.

questions.question: How are your assistants trained in security matters?
questions.text: We are currently actively exploring resources and courses on security and confidentiality. Stay tuned for updates in this section.

questions.question: How long do you store my data?
questions.text: We retain your data indefinitely unless we receive a request from you to delete it.

questions.question: What security measures do you use to protect my data?
questions.text: - AWS (Amazon Web Services): Implements physical, operational, and software security measures. AWS holds numerous security certifications, including ISO 27001, PCI DSS, and FIPS 140-2. - Telegram: End-to-end encryption is used in Telegram's secret chats to ensure confidentiality. Standard chats are encrypted between the client and server. It also stores messages, media files on its servers, with an option for user-initiated deletion. - MongoDB: Uses data encryption mechanisms both in storage and in transit. MongoDB also offers access control and audit tools. - ClickUp: ClickUp data is secured using SSL encryption, regular backups, and various access control mechanisms (from team level down to individual task levels).

questions.question: Who at JetOffice has access to my data?
questions.text: Your data in JetOffice is accessible by the account manager, assistant, project manager, sales team, and company founders.

questions.question: What will happen if there's a data breach?
questions.text: We are developing a plan of action for security breaches. We are also considering insuring against such an event. More details will be available soon.

questions.question: How do you process my personal data?
questions.text: Before starting to process your personal data, we ask for your consent according to our privacy policy. Your agreement is requested during your first interaction with the chatbot. Our privacy policy, in line with legislative norms, governs the collection, use, disclosure, storage, and protection of your personal data.

questions.question: Do your employees sign Non-Disclosure Agreements (NDA)?
questions.text: Yes, all our employees sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA) to ensure an additional level of protection for your data and confidential information.
